Post to Facebook Red Wings players, fans remember Mike Ilitch Red Wings players are wearing "Mr. I" patches.  //ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/detroit-red-wings-mike-ilitch-tribute-video-jerseys-fans-mr-i/   Red Wings players, fans remember Mike Ilitch Alysha Tsuji , USA TODAY 9:52 p.m. ET Feb. 15, 2017 
Hank Stawasz holds a sign in a tribute to Mike Ilitch at Joe Louis Arena before an NHL hockey game between the Detroit Red Wings and St. Louis Blues, Wednesday, Feb. 15, 2017, in Detroit. Billionaire businessman Ilitch, who founded the Little Caesars pizza empire before buying the Detroit Red Wings and Detroit Tigers died Friday. He was 87. (Photo: AP) 
Red Wings owner Mike Ilitch died on Feb. 10 at the age of 87. Throughout his life, Ilitch did a lot for not only the Detroit sports franchises he owned, but also for the city itself . When the news of his death broke, fans and athletes mourned , and on Wednesday night, the Red Wings celebrated his life. 
Before the game, there was a moment of silence and a tribute video about Ilitch that played, and afterwards, players tapped the ice with their sticks while fans applauded. — NHL on NBC (@NHLonNBCSports) February 16, 2017 
Additionally, the Red Wings are wearing patches to remember Mr. I. — Detroit Red Wings (@DetroitRedWings) February 15, 2017
